#15535 adds an optional "pedantic linter" by @Damiano Testa (off by default in Mathlib and downstream projects) which helps with formatting by highlighting places where the written code differs from the pretty-printed version.

I would have approved the PR myself, but I've now pushed my suggested fixes myself, so it would be nice if somebody else could give it a review!

I think it would be a useful tool to have: If a PR has very bad style, instead of highlighting/explaining all these things, a reviewer can simply suggest to have another cleanup round and might suggest using a temporary set_option linter.pedantic true to facilitate this.
